summary: This document is an email chain from July 2020 among federal prosecutors and FBI agents discussing the legal strategy for obtaining the real estate closing file for the property where Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested. The chain involves a New Hampshire real estate attorney who represented the purchasing entity and has offered her file, prompting internal discussion about the need for a 'friendly subpoena' and its approval requirements under the US Attorneys' Manual.

persons.name: Geoff
persons.role: U.S. Attorney or Assistant Attorney General
persons.context: Mentioned as the approving authority for a previous 'friendly subpoena' to a plaintiffs' attorney in the Hadden case, serving as a precedent for the current discussion.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the investigation; arrested at the property in question (338 E. Washington Road, Bradford, NH) on July 2, 2020. The emails discuss investigating her finances and ties to Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced in the context of the investigation into whether money from him was used to finance the purchase of the property and to buy Maxwell's silence.

persons.name: Jen and Steve Marshal
persons.context: Identified by the real estate attorney as the individuals who retained her. They are associated with the buying entity, Granite Realty, LLC.

connections.description: The email speculates that money from Epstein may have been used to finance Maxwell's purchase of the New Hampshire property, indicating a financial tie being investigated.
Jen and Steve Marshal are identified as the individuals who retained the attorney for the property purchase conducted by Granite Realty, LLC, linking them to Maxwell's asset.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested at the property located at 338 E. Washington Road, Bradford, New Hampshire.

events.title: Mortgage Banker's Conference
events.description: A real estate attorney met an FBI Special Agent at this conference in Portsmouth, NH, which later led to her reaching out about the Maxwell property.

keyFacts: The property at 338 E. Washington Road, Bradford, NH, was purchased by an entity called Granite Realty, LLC, and is where Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested on July 2, 2020.
Prosecutors were investigating whether Jeffrey Epstein's money was used to finance the purchase of this property, as part of examining Maxwell's finances and potential efforts to buy her silence.

A New Hampshire real estate attorney who handled the closing volunteered her file but requested a formal subpoena to comply with ethical obligations, leading to an internal DOJ discussion about 'friendly subpoena' procedures.
The email chain reveals internal legal debate about the necessity of U.S. Attorney approval for a 'friendly subpoena' and the relevance of the records to the grand jury's ongoing investigation.
Multiple FBI Special Agents and Assistant U.S. Attorneys are involved in the correspondence, but their names are redacted in the provided text.
